results.title: Arctic adventure
results.creator_credit: Tim Bain, Dynamite Entertainment and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: When a bunch of autocratic bears move into the Arctic Circle the lives of its penguin population are instantly and dramatically changed as the region is transformed into a jail-like ‘zoo’. All attempts are being made to break loose whilst young love hangs in the balance and the wily Tek (Kim Gyngell) insists they can fly and escape. But it’s war for Sergeant Pepper (Rod Quantock) who declares “I like the smell of snowballs in the morning” and a battle of wits (or faith) ensues. Voices by: Sigrid Thornton, Eric Bana, Kim Gyngell, Linda Gibson, John Clarke, Rod Quantock, Tim Bain and Adrian Vaughan. Written and directed by Tim Bain.

results.title: Arctic 4
results.creator_credit: Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A long film report of a new and daring step toward understanding what lies under the Arctic ice. This is the story of an Arctic diving expedition led by Dr. Joseph MacInnes and a team of scientists, during two months of continuous springtime daylight. The dives are a test of both men and equipment as well as an exploration of the high northern marine environment. What they discovered is interestingly documented in this film.

results.title: Arcs and sparks (Testing)
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces the scientific idea that magnetism and electricity are related. Shows some safe ways to investigate that relationship. Suitable for Upper-Primary students.

results.title: Architecture west
results.brief_description: Shows examples of architecture in the Western American states beginning with the square log block house that served as General Sheridan’s headquarters at Yam Hill, Oregon. The Monterey style house built for the American consul to Mexican California, a Victorian mansion, the First Church of Christ Scientist at Berkeley, the steel-aluminium -glass Equitable Building in Portland, Oregon, the Prudential building in Los Angeles, and modern homes designed by John Yoen, depicting important influences and style.

results.title: Architecture of Japan
results.brief_description: Shows how the traditional architectural design elements based on wooden construction are adopted to the steel and concrete in contemporary building in Japan. Examples of historical, traditional and modern architecture which are distinctively Japanese are surveyed.

results.title: Architecture
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, John Honey and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film, shot on location in Tasmania, showing the training and work of an architect. Discusses the nature of the careers available.

results.title: Architects of England
results.brief_description: A study of the work of English architects from the eleventh century until the present day, with reference to the kind of material and designs used and adapted for English needs, and the work of Inigo Jones and Christopher Wren.

results.title: Architect Athfield
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Examines the practical philosophy, the achievements and frustrations of one of New Zealand’s most lively and innovative architects, Ian Athfield. In 1975 Athfield won an international competition directed towards providing housing for 140,000 squatters from the Tondo area in Manila.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Arches of faith
results.creator_credit: Kurt Baum and African Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Voortrekker Memorial, the story behind it and its dedication in 1949. Bas-reliefs on the memorial and re-enacted sequences show the Voortrekkers setting out across the Brakensberg to the Free State, Natal and Transvaal, the massacre of Piet Retief’s party by Dingaan and his Zulu warriors, the subsequent Voortrekker victory at Bloody River, and the establishment of new farmlands. The celebrations at the dedication of the Memorial and the sentiments behind it.
